intro: Gutierrezia brachyris, commonly known as desert gum plant or silverleaf bush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and yellow flower heads. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its small, herbaceous stems and leaves are adapted to conserve water, making it well-suited for harsh desert conditions. Gutierrezia brachyris plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various desert wildlife.
